channel.title: iGEM at Berkeley
channel.description: Recent content on iGEM at Berkeley

item.title: Cellyse
item.description: Cellyse aims to implement an antibody-inducible system of cell lysis in a bacterium in hopes of increasing accessibility and affordability to antibody diagnostics.

item.title: Cheese Engineering
item.description: Fungal contamination of soft cheeses, such as feta, poses a significant problem for organic cheese farms.

item.title: CheRMiT
item.description: Manually updating and curating data on reactions from scientific literature is difficult and involves human curation.

item.title: Clonebots Assembly
item.description: Our project focuses on creating a faster and more efficient way to perform traditional cloning methods.

item.title: Clonebots Deletion
item.description: The Clonebot Deletion team’s mission is to develop a more efficient way to knockout genes in bacteria.

item.title: Hallucinating Scaffolds
item.description: Our team focuses on de novo protein design. We are interested in designing scaffolds for enzymatic active sites that support catalytic activity (i.

item.title: Protein-Protein Interactions
item.description: The PPI team is interested in designing potentially therapeutic inhibitors targeting disease-inducing protein-protein interactions.

item.title: KIO-TAPE BRAND
item.description: The “Seamless Watch” watch has all the features that users expect in a digital watch, and some unusual features.
